remixlab.dandelion.agent

Class ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent<P extends MotionProfile<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionAgent<M>
        • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionMotionAgent<M,C>
          • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionWheeledMotionAgent<MotionProfile<Constants.DOF1Action>,P,ClickProfile<Constants.ClickAction>>
            • remixlab.dandelion.agent.ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - MotionProfile parameterized with a Dandelion action
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HIDAgent, JoystickAgent, MouseAgent

    public class ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent<P extends MotionProfile<?>>
extends ActionWheeledMotionAgent<MotionProfile<Constants.DOF1Action>,P,ClickProfile<Constants.ClickAction>>
implements Constants
    An ActionWheeledMotionAgent that handles Dandelion motion actions (i.e., actions triggered from a MotionEvent). You should not instantiate this class but one of its derived ones: HIDAgent, JoystickAgent or MouseAgent.

    Dandelion actions can be handled by an AbstractScene, an InteractiveFrame or by an InteractiveEyeFrame. This class implements a generic Agent that represents any Human Interface Device (such as a mouse or a Joystick) and that handles actions to be executed only by an InteractiveFrame or an InteractiveEyeFrame (hence the name "bimotion"). AbstractScene actions are handled exclusively by a KeyboardAgent.

    The agent uses its Profiles (see below) to parse the generic BogusEvent to obtain a dandelion action, which is then sent to the proper ( Agent.inputGrabber()) Frame (InteractiveFrame or InteractiveEyeFrame) for its final execution. In case the grabber is not an instance of a Frame, but a different object which behavior you implemented (retrieved as with alienGrabber()), the agent sends the BogusEvent to it (please refer to ProScene's MouseGrabbers example).

    This agent holds the following InteractiveFrame Profiles: a frameProfile(), a frameClickProfile(), and a frameWheelProfile(); together with its InteractiveEyeFrame counterparts: a eyeProfile(), a eyeClickProfile(), and a eyeWheelProfile(). Simply retrieve a specific profile to bind an action to a shortcut, to remove it, or to check your current bindings.

    Note that the ActionWheeledMotionAgent holds only three profiles: ActionWheeledMotionAgent.wheelProfile(), ActionMotionAgent.clickProfile() and ActionMotionAgent.motionProfile(). The ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent renames this three profiles for the InteractiveFrame and add those of the InteractiveEyeFrame.
